text: You might consider upvoting this idea for better support of 3rd party cookie tool integration: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Cookie-consent-banner-API-Possibility-to-set-consent-status-by/idi-p/746725>
The cookiebot cookie banner API may have a callback function you can use to manually delete/manage cookies manually via JS when a user opts out

Hello all, I’m looking for someone (much cleverer than me!) to help with some programmable automation to fulfil a clients requirements regarding feeding data into their Netsuite portal. Can anyone recommend anyone on here that can help with the code / recipe?  :pray:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1675254414760279>

Hi everyone!
I need some help creating a CRM card to place files.
The problem is that client-facing teams need to put important files in a place different from "attachments". 
That feature needs to do something similar to "attachments", but instead of being connected to their emails.. is just for the user to be able to place files that can easily reach when they are talking to a client.

Is this a possibility?
You could possibly do this by connecting a file manger folder with each of the CRM records, and then uploading files to that folder would show up on the side bar

You would then need to make a serverless function to search for any folder associated to the record you are currently on. Then send back all the file names to the crm card with the links to the file in the file manager

Thank you for your help!

QQ. In terms of the process, the client-facing teams need to be able to easily add the files associated to a deal. But in this scenario of connecting the file Manager with the CRM record:
• will the user need to go to file manager, create a folder, and then go back to the deal and add it somehow?
• Or simply the user will click "add" and will be able to create a folder or browse in other folder, like it is an image? (attached the example on how the user might see it :point_down:)
They would need to create a folder you could do that automatically
they would just need to click the add a file button and it would link them out to the folder
after the reload they would then see the folder and files
Amazing! Thank you a lot
<@U01QVR44MEY> Thanks a lot from me as well, i need something similar for a project!
of course, let me know if you have any other questions
Anyone here have an app they use/recommend for instagram feed onto a HubSpot website?
I think there are some workarounds, but every dev I've asked has told me it isn't possible with HS due to security
Can’t build a custom module with instagram api?
You could just turn it into a RSS feed <https://rss.app/blog/how-to-create-instagram-rss-feeds-pGHJKx>
Sooo many RSS feeds composers for testimonials and stuff

Hey...   Also new here.  I have a really basic (I think) question, as CMS development is generally not something I do.  So this whole process is pretty alien to me.

When creating a new page, is there any _real_ difference between a Website Page & a Landing Page?  Why would I want to create one as opposed to the other?

hey bob!  welcome to the world of HubSpot.  I was also confused by the difference.
here is an article from HubSpot about landing pages
and here is a screengrab from that article defining it.
at the basic developer level, they are basically the same.  it is more from a marketing thing of a ma jigger
also, i congratulate you on becoming a wizard :laughing:
Ah, that's what I was wondering.  I'm generally on the coding side of things.  Marketing distinctions are generally completely lost on me.  :grin:

in my experience, the make up of a landing page has been
limited to no nav at the top
a pitch and a form that leads to some content
you will probably want to have a landing page template as well as some website templates in your pocket for our marketing friends :slightly_smiling_face:

For the moment, I just have to produce a POC.  We're building a new marketplace and since the company already pays for HubSpot, they were thinking of using it to build the storefront, rather than creating it from scratch.  I wound up with the job of determining whether or not HubSpot will do the job.
Most of my experiences dealing with CMS-type products have been pretty awful.  But I don't hate this so far.  :slightly_smiling_face:
ha!
our aim is that you dont hate it.  we set a high bar :grin:

From reading the docs and watching a bunch of the Academy videos, I'm reasonably sure HubSpot is going to be able to handle this.

I just need to learn the tools.  It's a weird thing to come at it from this direction, when you're used to sitting in front of an IDE all day...
Anyway, thanks for the info!
Hi! Is it just me or the "horizontal" option in the Simple Menu module was not working? It only displays vertically. Appreciate your input! :pray:
you came to the right place to talk about it.  some really smart cookies in here.   dont forget about our community forums as well <http://community.HubSpot.com|community.HubSpot.com>.

Hey all, can someone please try to send a HubSpot email that includes a transparent PNG as a test? Yesterday the background was white/transparent. Testing now and transparent PNGs have a black background. I need to know if this is a gmail bug/HubSpot bug or what's happening
Oh, yes.  Thanks.  I actually _had_ forgotten about that!
thank you, very much appreciate it
of course
That was a test for sending to my gmail but because it didn't come out black I think that hopefully answers your question
yea, it raises a lot of new questions but that definitely helps
I can't imagine why pngs for me would suddenly be black
would you mind setting the background color in that email to gray and then sending it again (I know that's a lot to ask!)
your good man, of course. one moment
awesome, thanks again
email is a mystery wrapped in an enigma
Seriously, do you have a screenshot?
Can you right click on the PNG and click copy image address and share it?
yea, I'll send in a DM
hi gang! thx for the invite <@U0336QCR2FQ>

One other thing that might be helpful to note regarding the difference between website and landing pages is that website pages are automatically in your sitemap xml, whereas landing pages aren't and would have to be manually added. A landing page is typically content you don't include in your navigation/menu, but has a lot of marketing purposes. The biggest technical difference is definitely the sitemap.
<@U0336QCR2FQ> is the GOAT
